isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Disassembly

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

step1.para: Rotate the transfer case in the repair stand so that the yoke being removed faces UPWARD.
Remove the yoke locknuts and washers from the front and rear output shafts.
Use a yoke puller to remove the yokes from the output shafts. Do not remove the deflector from the yoke or flange unless it is damaged.
Loosen but do not remove the front input yoke, locknut and washer from the front input shaft, input bearing cage and pump assembly. The yoke is used to lift the assembly from the transfer case.

MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases only: Remove the rear input shaft cover capscrews and rear cover (or PTO, if equipped) from the rear transfer case cover. Refer to Optional PTO Assembly on MTC-4208 and -4210 Transfer Cases.
MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases only: Use a modified 3/4-inch drive three-inch socket to remove the large input-shaft retaining nut located on the opposite end of the yoke.
